title: Simulation-Based Culturally Responsive Mathematics Teaching Online Training: Utilizing Equations, Graphs, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic mathematics pedagogy and the ability to apply fundamental formulas and equations
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented environment for strengthening math teaching competencies reflecting multicultural learners' characteristics. Includes simulation activities focusing on graph interpretation, problem-solving strategies, and calculation skills improvement.

learning_goals: Applying three or more culturally responsive teaching methods per subject in a simulated environment while developing problem-solving skills in mathematics using equation, graph, and statistical analysis tools

Learners use a VR-based feedback system (MathVR Pro) to design personalized mathematics instruction strategies for three or more learner types (visual/auditory/kinesthetic), achieving over 80% suitability scores in peer and expert reviews

Completing a project to develop mathematics assessment tools reflecting multicultural learner characteristics: designing probability- and statistics-based evaluation items and integrating proof processes
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
